system.description:
To detect a secret door, a character must specify the exact area being searched. The process typically takes one turn (10 minutes) for each 10-foot section of wall, floor, or ceiling. Elves, due to their keen sight, are given a bonus of 1 to their roll.
Either the Dungeon Master should roll or the roll should be blind, regardless of whether a secret door is present, to maintain player uncertainty. Once found, the location of the secret door can be noted, allowing future discovery without a roll.
